gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.csv
Class CSVMetadataTreeModel

java.lang.Object
  javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel
      gov.nih.nci.hl7.ui.csv.CSVMetadataTreeModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.swing.tree.TreeModel
public class CSVMetadataTreeModel
extends javax.swing.tree.DefaultTreeModel

The class defines a default tree model to support the tree modification and navigation in CSV Panel.

Version:
Since caAdapter v1.2 revision $Revision: 1.1 $ date $Date: 2006-10-03 17:36:02 $
Author:
OWNER: Scott Jiang, LAST UPDATE $Author: marwahah $

Creates a tree specifying whether any node can have children, or whether only certain nodes can have children.

Parameters:
root - a TreeNode object that is the root of the tree
asksAllowsChildren - a boolean, false if any node can have children, true if each node is asked to see if it can have children
See Also:
DefaultTreeModel.asksAllowsChildren

public boolean isLeaf(java.lang.Object node)

getDeepCopy

protected javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode getDeepCopy(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode sourceNode)
The clone() method in DefaultMutableTreeNode class only return a shallow copy of itself. This function will create and return a copy of the sub-tree of the given tree node, including the given node, its parent will set to be null, to avoid deletion from add.

Parameters:
sourceNode -
Returns:
the tree node after copying.

isChildAcceptableToParent

public boolean isChildAcceptableToParent(javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode childNode,
                                         javax.swing.tree.DefaultMutableTreeNode parentNode,
                                         boolean isToCopyChildren)
This method is better to be called "BEFORE" actually add the given child to the parent. Apply the business logic in validators to verify if the given child is acceptable to the given parent node.

Parameters:
childNode -
parentNode -
isToCopyChildren - if true, each of the child will be potentially copied to the new parent instead of moving under the parent.
Returns:
true if acceptable; false otherwise.
